billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO INVESTIGATIONS AND GOVERNMENT OPERATIONS

title: Requires the deposit, into the dedicated highway and bridge trust fund, of a portion of the sales tax collected on each gallon of motor fuel sold at retail
summary: Requires the deposit, into the dedicated highway and bridge trust fund, of a portion of the sales tax collected on each gallon of motor fuel sold at retail.

       Introduced  by  Sen.  LIBOUS -- read twice and ordered printed, and when

       AN ACT to amend the tax law and the state finance law,  in  relation  to
         providing  for the deposit into the dedicated highway and bridge trust
         fund of a portion of the sales tax revenue from the sale of motor fuel

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 1148 of the tax law, as amended by chapter 3 of the
    2  laws of 2004, is amended to read as follows:
    3    S 1148. Deposit and disposition of revenue. [All] (A) EXCEPT AS OTHER-
    4  WISE  PROVIDED  IN  SUBDIVISION (B) OF THIS SECTION, ALL taxes, interest
    5  and penalties collected or received by the commissioner under this arti-
    6  cle shall be deposited and disposed of pursuant  to  the  provisions  of
    7  section one hundred seventy-one-a of this chapter; provided however, the
    8  comptroller  shall  on  or before the twelfth day of each month, pay all
    9  such taxes, interest and penalties  collected  under  this  article  and
   10  remaining  to  the comptroller's credit in such banks, banking houses or
   11  trust companies at the close of business on the last day of the  preced-
   12  ing month, into the general fund of the state treasury, except as other-
   13  wise  provided  in  sections  ninety-two-d and ninety-two-r of the state
   14  finance law and sections eleven hundred two,  eleven  hundred  four  and
   15  eleven hundred nine of this article.
   16    (B)  ONE  CENT  OF THE TAXES COLLECTED OR RECEIVED BY THE COMMISSIONER
   17  UNDER THIS ARTICLE FOR THE RETAIL SALE OF  EACH  GALLON  OF  MOTOR  FUEL
   18  SHALL  BE  DEPOSITED  IN  THE  DEDICATED  HIGHWAY AND BRIDGE TRUST FUND,
   19  ESTABLISHED BY SECTION EIGHTY-NINE-B OF THE STATE FINANCE LAW.
   20    S 2. Subdivision (b) of section 1148 of  the  tax  law,  as  added  by
   21  section one of this act, is amended to read as follows:
   22    (b)  [One  cent]  TWO  CENTS of the taxes collected or received by the
   23  commissioner under this article for the retail sale of  each  gallon  of

    1  motor  fuel shall be deposited in the dedicated highway and bridge trust
    2  fund, established by section eighty-nine-b of the state finance law.
    3    S  3.  Subdivision  (b)  of section 1148 of the tax law, as amended by
    4  section two of this act, is amended to read as follows:
    5    (b) [Two] THREE cents of  the  taxes  collected  or  received  by  the
    6  commissioner  under  this  article for the retail sale of each gallon of
    7  motor fuel shall be deposited in the dedicated highway and bridge  trust
    8  fund, established by section eighty-nine-b of the state finance law.
    9    S  4.  Subdivision  (b)  of section 1148 of the tax law, as amended by
   10  section three of this act, is amended to read as follows:
   11    (b) [Three] FOUR cents of the  taxes  collected  or  received  by  the
   12  commissioner  under  this  article for the retail sale of each gallon of
   13  motor fuel shall be deposited in the dedicated highway and bridge  trust
   14  fund, established by section eighty-nine-b of the state finance law.
   15    S  5.  Subdivision  (b)  of section 1148 of the tax law, as amended by
   16  section four of this act, is amended to read as follows:
   17    (b) [Four] FIVE cents of  the  taxes  collected  or  received  by  the
   18  commissioner  under  this  article for the retail sale of each gallon of
   19  motor fuel shall be deposited in the dedicated highway and bridge  trust
   20  fund, established by section eighty-nine-b of the state finance law.
   21    S  6. Subdivision 4 of section 89-b of the state finance law, as added
   22  by chapter 56 of the laws of 1993, is amended to read as follows:
   23    4. The highway and bridge capital account shall  consist  (I)  of  all
   24  moneys  transferred  from  the  special  obligation  reserve and payment
   25  account, (II) OF ALL MONEYS REQUIRED TO BE DEPOSITED  IN  THE  DEDICATED
   26  HIGHWAY  AND  BRIDGE  TRUST  FUND PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION (B) OF SECTION
   27  ELEVEN HUNDRED FORTY-EIGHT OF THE TAX LAW, and (III) OF any other moneys
   28  credited or transferred thereto from any other fund, account or source.
   29    S 7. This act shall take effect April 1, 2012, provided, that:
   30    (a) section two of this act shall take effect April 1, 2013;
   31    (b) section three of this act shall take effect April 1, 2014;
   32    (c) section four of this act shall take effect April 1, 2015; and
   33    (d) section five of this act shall take effect April 1, 2016.
